name: SSC CHSL (Combined Higher Secondary Level Exam)
description: A national-level examination conducted by the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) to recruit candidates for various posts such as Lower Divisional Clerk (LDC), Junior Secretariat Assistant (JSA), and Data Entry Operators (DEO) in different Ministries, Departments, and Organizations of the Government of India.

eligibility.ageLimit: 18-27 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories (SC, ST, OBC, PwBD, etc.) as per government rules.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Candidates must have passed the 12th Standard or equivalent examination from a recognized Board or University.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal/Bhutan, or a Tibetan refugee who came to India before January 1, 1962.

timeline.examDate: Tier-I: July 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 2024. Tier-II: To be notified later.
timeline.resultDate: Results for each tier are declared a few weeks after the exam. Final results are declared after all stages are completed.

stages.name: Stage 1: Tier-I Examination
stages.description: An objective multiple-choice paper of 200 marks with 100 questions, to be completed in 60 minutes. It has 4 sections. This is a qualifying screening test.

stages.name: Stage 2: Tier-II Examination
stages.description: Consists of sessions with different modules. Session I includes Mathematical Abilities, Reasoning, English, General Awareness, and Computer Knowledge. Session II includes a Skill Test/Typing Test which is qualifying in nature. Marks from Session I determine the final merit.

stages.name: Stage 3: Document Verification
stages.description: Candidates who qualify all stages are recommended for appointment, and document verification is conducted by the concerned user department.

examPattern.markingScheme:
Tier-I: +2 marks for each correct answer and -0.5 marks for each wrong answer. 
Tier-II: For Section-I, Section-II and Module-I of Section-III, there is a negative marking of 1 mark for each wrong answer. The Computer Knowledge Test and Skill/Typing Test are qualifying.

syllabus.name: General Intelligence
topics: Semantic Analogy, Symbolic operations, Number Analogy
Semantic Series, Figural Pattern-folding and completion
Number Series, Embedded figures, Figural Series
Critical Thinking, Problem Solving, Emotional Intelligence, Word Building

syllabus.name: General Awareness
topics: Current affairs and matters of every day observation and experience

syllabus.name: Quantitative Aptitude
topics: Fundamental arithmetical operations (Percentages, Ratio and Proportion, Square roots, Averages, Interest, Profit and Loss, Discount)

syllabus.name: English Language
topics: Spot the Error, Fill in the Blanks
